Asunto: Seek Compensation from the Federal Ministry, Mobility and Infrastructure Republic of Austria
Reseña:
I purchased a Eurail Global Pass 7 days within 1 month for me and my wife on 3/07/25 for $924. On 3/16/2025 I booked a reservation for a sleeper cabin the Nightjet NJ421 for 09/012/2025 Amsterdam 19:00 direct to Munich 09/13/2025 7:06 for which I paid €739,80. The OBB website states that “The costs for the journey, the reservation in the respective travel category and breakfast in the couchette or sleeper coach are already included here.” When I purchased the reservation under “Discounts” I entered that I had “Eurail Pass” for my wife and myself. I obviously assumed I was getting a discount for having paid for the train portion of this reservation with a Eurail pass since there is a dropdown box that states "Discount for Eurail/Interrail".
When I received a notice that my schedule had changed in early September, it came to my attention that OBB is charging the same amount for reservations+tickets whether or not you use your EURAIL passes for the Ticket portion of the reservation that is purported to be giving a discount. I submitted examples showing in 2 instances the same price was to be charged whether I had an Eurail or not. Both ticket prices are the same for 2 different dates of service. Two of these reservations showed that I was getting a EURAIL discount, however there was no discount given on the ticket portion on the total expense. I contacted OBB on September 7 and it took almost a month to get back to me. On 10/06/2025 I received a response from OBB “It states that you must select “Semi Flex” when booking in order to choose a discount with the Interrail ticket. I can see that you have chosen a standard ticket without a discount.” The next email “the ticket you have selected is the ticket without the Interrail ticket discount. You can view the respective discounts in the ticket details.” I feel that OBB is purposely deceiving travelers into thinking they are getting a discounted price for this type of travel (with Eurail) because no where on the website is this information provided to customers.
I submitted my information to the Federal Ministry, Mobility and Infrastructure Republic of Austria and filed a complaint against OBB. This led to arbitration and I was offered 180€ of free travel vouchers I can use over the next 10 years. I really wanted OBB to make their pricing more transparent but this is all I could do. I would encourage travellers who have been screwed by OBB to file complaints against them with the Federal Ministry, Mobility and Infrastructure Republic of Austria and seek some compensation.
By the Way the overnight experience from Amsterdam to Munich was equivalent to having someone hit you with a baseball bat for 12 hrs. I had reserved a cabin for 2 with a WC and shower. The bed was as hard as a rock, the wifi was non-existant, the train rocked all night and no instructions how to get to the top bunk. I will never do that again particularly with OBB.

Das ist respektlos und verantwortungslos. So behandelt man keine Menschen. Man kann verstehen, dass Störungen passieren, aber was hier abläuft, ist reine Ignoranz gegenüber den Fahrgästen. Keine Betreuung, keine Organisation, keine Empathie einfach gar nichts.

Ich will, dass Sie sich das ernsthaft anschauen und erklären, wie so etwas überhaupt passieren kann. Wie kann es sein, dass Menschen über Stunden festgehalten werden, ohne dass jemand reagiert oder wenigstens versucht, die Situation menschlich zu gestalten?

Ich erwarte eine sofortige Stellungnahme und eine angemessene Entschädigung. So ein Verhalten darf nicht einfach unter „Pech gehabt“ fallen das ist schlicht unmenschlich.

Net terug van mijn 5 daagse citytrip Wenen. Ik reis meestal alleen en vindt het ook leuk om zo af en toe wat te proberen. Dus afgelopen week voor de eerste keer met de Nightjet van de Oostenrijkse ÖBB. De heenreis ging eigenlijk heel goed. De trein was op tijd en geen vertraging. Ook was alles in orde omtrent mijn slaapcabine en het personeel was vriendelijk en service gericht. Maar de terugreis ... Dit was verschrikkelijk.
Het begon al met het welkom heette, door het personeel (NOT). Omdat ik in een rolstoel zit, had ik een speciale slaapcabine. Deze cabine is ruim en heeft automatische deuren. Van binnenuit kan je deze openen met een drukknop en van buitenuit met een keycard. Nu begint het: Nadat ik werd begeleid naar mijn cabine en plaats nam, heb ik direct even gecheckt of de deuren met de drukknop open gingen. Dat was goed dat ik dit had gedaan. De deuren deden het niet. Heel laconiek zeiden ze tegen mij, dat ik dit maar met de hand moest doen. Ik gaf aan dat ik dit niet kan en dat de deuren gewoon moeten werken. Met veel gezucht en een discussie werd er iemand bijgehaald. Deze medewerker resetten de deuren en ze deden het. Fijn ... kan ik gewoon uit mij cabine komen, wanneer ik naar het toilet moet. Wat denk je? Kom ik terug van het toilet, doet de keycard het niet. Sta ik daar in het gangpad, buitengesloten van mijn cabine. Dit was nog vroeg in de avond, dus kwam er regelmatig een staff medewerker voorbij gelopen. Zo heb ik dit probleem meerdere malen gehad. Midden in de nacht heb ik zelfs 20 minuten buiten gestaan, in het gangpad, omdat er geen enkele medewerker te bekennen was. Uiteindelijk heeft een andere passagier, een medewerker gehaald. Ook heb ik 1x gehad dat de deuren van binnenuit niet open gingen en heb ik lopen kloppen op de deur, net zolang tot dat er iemand kwam. In de cabine zit ook een "service" knop, hier werd ook niet op gereageerd. Nadat ik me in de ochtend had aangekleed, heb ik de deuren maar open laten staan. Ik was er helemaal klaar mee. Het ontbijt wat ik kreeg was ijskoud. Het leek alsof ze het te laat uit de koeling hadden gehaald en snel wilde serveren. Persoonlijk vond ik het personeel niet meelevend en toonde weinig empathie. Ook bijzonder dat personeel, dat op een internationale trein werkt, zo slecht Engels spreken. Dit zou een minimaal vereiste moeten zijn.

First the train had 1,5h delay, its supposed to be a night train but its not any different from a normal train, the seats are small and the ac was turned on the full volume, which was highly uncomfortable. Then we got awakened by the police, which checked our IDs after midnight. Throughout the journey the train gathered 7 hours of delay in total, we got almost zero information, and if we did then it was in german (which we dont understand), the radio that announced the information was very quiet. We couldnt even buy food because of the confusing information from the employees. Then right before our stop (Amsterdam) we got announced that the train wont continue any further, no help from the staff, we got zero explanation, they just told us to leave and didnt offer any alternative on how to get to our destination.
kein drucker dabei, konnten unseren kaffe nicht genießen, flieger verpasst!

Dear OEBB, traveling with your company was hell. I purchased first class tickets, no transfer, for me and my 5yo kid, aprox. one month before our trip to Terst. Two weeks before trip, you send me e-mail to inform me about some complications on track. So my brother in law, who is german native speaker, call your customer line to ask if I should cancel or rebook? Your employee inform us, its ok, maybe there will be part of the journey on bus or some delay.
So, we have to change from bus to train and back six times, nothing like the first class and it will take from Trieste to Wienna more than 20 hours!!! Your "replacement bus servis for certain part of the trail" (??) in reality means bus from Trieste Centrale to Sežana. Then change to train to Logatec. Then change to bus to Ljubljana. Where your replacement services collapsed. Nobody knows anything, no relevant infos. Your replacement bus from Logatec was delayed, so we can't catch the Wienna train and another train was replaced by bus to Kranje again, then we have to change again and go by train to Villach. Delayed 22 minutes, so we mised train to Wienna and have to wait on the train station for 7 hour (and counting)! Thru night, with 5yo kid. Thank you very much, really.
In fact I am writing this in Villach (1:52 a.m.), still waiting for train to Wienna. Currently more than hour delayed. With my kid trying to sleep on my lap. Maybe there is no train to Wienna, maybe we both are going to die here.

Wienna - Trieste with Flixbus 6:45. No transfer. Trieste - Wienna with OEBB: >21 hours, 5 transfers. And again, I bought first class ticket, without any changes of vehicles! And your employee told us, it's not big deal, maybe some part of the road by bus and that's it. Are you crazy or WTF?! Why don't you tell us, you are not able to provide in current conditions any service and give me money back, so we can travel by bus. Or maybe walk. It could be faster.

It was terrible expirience! Two trains from Munchen to Villach were canceled and we had to stay in Munchen for more than 9 hours. Than we have finally arrived in Villach and we had to sleepover in hotel that costs us 200€. They didn't give us any money back and we strongly recomend NOT to drive with OEBB trains.

Asunto: They will fine you, stay away!
Reseña:
This company is a total fraud! As much as possible stay away from them. I paid for tickets in a machine in Vienna for a trip to Bratislava. The conductor/ticket controller claimed it to be unvalid, and forced me to pay a fine for 105 €. The machine unfortunately have bad translations from German to English, so one of my tickets were a discount ticket to a card I don’t hold instead of a «Comfort» ticket which I thought was better seats. I offered to pay the difference, but the angry man refused to listen and to execute good judgment of the situation. The customer service just said it’s important to treat all customers fairly, so therefore they will not give refunds, and that this would be their final answer to my case.
Unless you want a extra cost for 105€, choose another transportation company.

Ich fasse es kurz. Ein Kontrolleur im Zug hat mir gesagt, dass meine Jahreskarte nicht gültig wäre, obwohl ich ihr gezeigt habe, dass alle Daten auf dem Screenshot stehen. Sie hat es nicht mal angeschaut, nicht mal gelesen und hat mich bedroht. Meine Karte bzw. Screenshot würde nur eine Rechnung sein. Nein, ist es nicht! Ich habe ihr angeboten, mit ihrem Handy meinen Bildschirm abzufotografieren, sie lehnte ab und hat mich stattdessen blöd angemacht vor anderen Fahrgästen, als ob ich es nötig hätte, sie anzülügen. Ich stand als Lügnerin da, als ich aussteigen musste. Das akzeptiere ich nicht. Sie sollten Ihren Zugkontrolleuren beibringen, dass sie den Fahrgästen richtig zuhören sollen. Und dass man mich gleich bedroht mit Strafe, dies das, das geht gar nicht! Vor allem nicht, weil ich eine Jahreskarte habe! Ich wohne in der Schweiz und arbeite in Österreich und habe meine Jahreskarte in der Schweiz gekauft! Das ist eine Frechheit, wie sich Ihre Ticketkontrolleure gegenüber Menschen verhalten, nur weil sie ein Jahresabo aus einem anderen Land nicht kennen!!! Schulen Sie bitte Ihre Kontrolleure, dass es Jahresabos von anderen Ländern gibt!

Asunto: Behinderung von Behinderten durch die ÖBB
Reseña:

Ging online nicht. Ich wollte Hilfe bei 051717 holen.
Dort wurde mir gesagt, dass am 10.08. ein Schienenersatzverkehr zwischen Kufstein und Salzburg eingesetzt wird, nur, für den Schienenersatzverkehr kann kein Sitzplatz reserviert werden. Danke ÖBB und Klimaticket. Bei der Westbahn kann mann wenigstens buchen, allerdings muss ich da um 5:09 Uhr in Bregenz abfahren. Danke Westbahn für die Kundenorientierung. Ich habe mich diesbezüglich auch an den Volksanwalt gewandt... - Meine Meinung, Behinderte werden von der ÖBB behindert......

I was traveling on with my family from Basel to Hamburg 13 July 2025. (NJ470) The sleeping cabins were fully booked so we have to book seats.
The seats had bad comfort. Hard armrests and the backrest could not be adjusted. No wifi. Bright light in the train during the night even though they switched of half of the flourescent lights late in the evening. There were no soap on the toilets and after a few hours the toilet paper ran out. No one came to refill it.
The train were delayed at worst two hours during the night but you didn't know it if you didn't look at DBs homepage when you could reach the cellular network near the cities. No signs, messages in loudspeakers or any information at all onbord the train.
On the hompage were clear information on which stations the train would stop, where people were allowed to board and not. During the night the train did several unannounced stops were people did board the train. During the entire travel (12 hours) I only saw staff from DB once. I guess the people who boarded and left the train during the night were free riders. Some passengers were drunk and seemed to be high on drugs and were shouting and arguing with other passengers and tried to take over their reserved seats. The coach didn't have any CCTV. I had to stay awake the whole night to be able to keep my family safe in case of fights or thieves. Finally we arrived at Hamburg 57 minutes late. At the first time we heard a voice in the loudspeakers. Though a pre-recorded voice wishing us a good day. No information at all.
If you ever think about boarding this train, bring an assault alarm. Bring soft pillows, blankets, noice cancelling headphones and sleeping masks to be able to sleep. Bring soap, toiletpaper and cleaning wipes to be able to use the toilet. Or just get yourself a hotel room and take the train next morning.

Asunto: Misleading information will get you fined.
Reseña:
The OBB ticket machine at Vienna airport offers a journey to center of Vienna for 7 euros. For 17 euros however they offer 72 hours travel all around Vienna using buses,trains and trams. Sounds like a reasonable deal?
Wrong.!!
You have just left yourself open to a 105 euro fine which will be rigorously enforced. If you have the audacity to question this, believing that you have done nothing wrong and not pay the on the spot fine and ask time to check and clarify, that will cost you
another 30 euros administration fee.
Yes, because the ticket they sell you at the ticket machine at Vienna airport for use all over Vienna is not valid to or from Vienna airport.
So you see it's all your fault, not theirs for being ambiguous or unclear.
135 euros in fines plus 17 euros for the original ticket or 36 euros door to door in an Uber?
I know what I will be doing if there's ever a next time...
